required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Phase 1 Single/Multiple Dose Study Of PF-06293620 To Assess Safety, Tolerability And Pharmacokinetics In Subjects With Type 2 Diabetes Mellitus
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase 1 Double-blind, Placebo-controlled, Randomized, Single- And Multiple-ascending Dose Study To Assess The Safety, Tolerability, And Pharmacokinetics Of Pf-06293620 In Subjects With Type 2 Diabetes Mellitus

brief_summary.textblock: A first in human study to determine the safety, tolerability and pharmacokinetics of single and multiple ascending doses of PF-06293620 in subjects with Type 2 Diabetes Mellitus

primary_outcome.measure: Number and Percentage of Participants With Treatment-Emergent Adverse Events (AEs) or Serious Adverse Events (SAEs) - Single Ascending Dose Cohorts (SAD)
primary_outcome.description: An AE was any untoward medical occurrence in a participant who received study drug without regard to possibility of causal relationship. An SAE was an AE resulting in any of the following outcomes or deemed significant for any other reason: death; initial or prolonged inpatient hospitalization; life-threatening experience (immediate risk of dying); persistent or significant disability/incapacity; congenital anomaly. Treatment-emergent are events between first dose of study drug and up to 85 days after last dose that were absent before treatment or that worsened relative to pretreatment state.

primary_outcome.measure: Number and Percentage of Participants With Treatment-Emergent Adverse Events (AEs) or Serious Adverse Events (SAEs) related to drug treatment- Single Ascending Dose Cohorts (SAD)
primary_outcome.description: An AE was any untoward medical occurrence in a participant who received study drug with the possibility of causal relationship. An SAE was an AE resulting in any of the following outcomes or deemed significant for any other reason: death; initial or prolonged inpatient hospitalization; life-threatening experience (immediate risk of dying); persistent or significant disability/incapacity; congenital anomaly. Treatment related AEs are events between first dose of study drug and up to 85 days after last dose that were absent before treatment or that worsened relative to pretreatment state.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of participants with dose limiting or intolerable adverse events - SAD Cohorts
primary_outcome.description: Dose-limiting or intolerable toxicities defined by common terminology criteria for adverse events (CTCAE) in 2 or more subjects per treatment arm

primary_outcome.measure: Number and Percentage of Participants With Treatment-Emergent Adverse Events (AEs) or Serious Adverse Events (SAEs) - Multiple Ascending Dose Cohorts (MAD)
primary_outcome.description: An AE was any untoward medical occurrence in a participant who received study drug without regard to possibility of causal relationship. An SAE was an AE resulting in any of the following outcomes or deemed significant for any other reason: death; initial or prolonged inpatient hospitalization; life-threatening experience (immediate risk of dying); persistent or significant disability/incapacity; congenital anomaly. Treatment-emergent are events between first dose of study drug and up to 85 days after last dose that were absent before treatment or that worsened relative to pretreatment state.

primary_outcome.measure: Number and Percentage of Participants With Treatment-Emergent Adverse Events (AEs) or Serious Adverse Events (SAEs) related to drug treatment- Multiple Ascending Dose Cohorts (MAD)
primary_outcome.description: An AE was any untoward medical occurrence in a participant who received study drug with the possibility of causal relationship. An SAE was an AE resulting in any of the following outcomes or deemed significant for any other reason: death; initial or prolonged inpatient hospitalization; life-threatening experience (immediate risk of dying); persistent or significant disability/incapacity; congenital anomaly. Treatment related AEs are events between first dose of study drug and up to 85 days after last dose that were absent before treatment or that worsened relative to pretreatment state.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of participants with dose limiting or intolerable adverse events - MAD Cohorts
primary_outcome.description: Dose-limiting or intolerable toxicities defined by common terminology criteria for adverse events (CTCAE) in 2 or more subjects per treatment arm

secondary_outcome.measure: Area Under the Curve From Time Zero to Last Quantifiable Concentration (AUClast) - SAD Cohorts
secondary_outcome.description: Area under the plasma concentration time-curve from zero to the last measured concentration (AUClast)

secondary_outcome.measure: Area Under the Curve From Time Zero to Extrapolated Infinite Time [AUC (0 - 85)] - SAD Cohorts
secondary_outcome.description: AUC (0 - 85)= Area under the plasma concentration versus time curve (AUC) from time zero (pre-dose) to extrapolated infinite time (0 - 85). It is obtained from AUC (0 - t) plus AUC (t - 8).
CL is a quantitative measure of the rate at which a drug substance is removed from the body.

Clearance of a drug is a measure of the rate at which a drug is metabolized or eliminated by normal biological processes. Clearance obtained after oral dose (apparent oral clearance) is influenced by the fraction of the dose absorbed. Clearance was estimated from population pharmacokinetic (PK) modeling. Drug clearance is a quantitative measure of the rate at which a drug substance is removed from the blood.

secondary_outcome.measure: Time to Reach Maximum Observed Plasma Concentration (Tmax)- SAD Cohorts
Apparent Volume of Distribution (Vz/F)- SAD Cohorts
secondary_outcome.description: Volume of distribution is defined as the theoretical volume in which the total amount of drug would need to be uniformly distributed to produce the desired plasma concentration of a drug. Apparent volume of distribution after oral dose (Vz/F) is influenced by the fraction absorbed.
Plasma decay half-life is the time measured for the plasma concentration to decrease by one half.

secondary_outcome.measure: Area Under the Curve From Time Zero to Last Quantifiable Concentration (AUClast) - MAD Cohorts
secondary_outcome.description: Area under the plasma concentration time-curve from zero to the last measured concentration (AUClast)

secondary_outcome.measure: Area Under the Curve From Time Zero to Extrapolated Infinite Time [AUC (0 - 85)] - MAD Cohorts
secondary_outcome.description: AUC (0 - 85)= Area under the plasma concentration versus time curve (AUC) from time zero (pre-dose) to extrapolated infinite time (0 - 85). It is obtained from AUC (0 - t) plus AUC (t - 8).
CL is a quantitative measure of the rate at which a drug substance is removed from the body.

Clearance of a drug is a measure of the rate at which a drug is metabolized or eliminated by normal biological processes. Clearance obtained after oral dose (apparent oral clearance) is influenced by the fraction of the dose absorbed. Clearance was estimated from population pharmacokinetic (PK) modeling. Drug clearance is a quantitative measure of the rate at which a drug substance is removed from the blood.

secondary_outcome.measure: Time to Reach Maximum Observed Plasma Concentration (Tmax)- MAD Cohorts
Apparent Volume of Distribution (Vz/F)- MAD Cohorts
secondary_outcome.description: Volume of distribution is defined as the theoretical volume in which the total amount of drug would need to be uniformly distributed to produce the desired plasma concentration of a drug. Apparent volume of distribution after oral dose (Vz/F) is influenced by the fraction absorbed.
Plasma decay half-life is the time measured for the plasma concentration to decrease by one half.

intervention.description: Intravenous infusion normal saline single dose
Subcutaneous injection multiple dose 75 mg (Days 1, 29 and 57)
Subcutaneous injection normal saline multiple dose (Days 1, 29 and 57)
Subcutaneous injection multiple dose 150 mg (Days 1, 29 and 57)
Subcutaneous injection normal saline multiple dose (Days 1, 29 and 57)

Subcutaneous injection normal saline multiple dose (Days 1, 29 and 57)
Subcutaneous injection multiple dose TBD mg (Days TBD)

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Men and women of non-childbearing potential with Type 2 Diabetes Mellitus
- Subjects on stable doses of metformin >/= 1500 mg daily (SAD cohorts) or >/= 1000 mg daily (MAD cohorts) x 30 days prior to screening
- HbA1c 7-10% (SAD Cohorts) or 6.5-10% (MAD cohorts) inclusive at screening
- Fasting C-peptide >1.12 ng/mL (SAD cohorts) or >/= 0.8 mg/mL (MAD cohorts) at screening
Exclusion Criteria:
- History of Type 1 diabetes mellitus
- Evidence of diabetic complications with significant end-organ damage
- History of chronic pancreatitis or at high risk for pancreatitis
- Poorly controlled hypertension
- History of cardiovascular or cerebrovascular event or procedure
